article.description: Taylor's late layup lifts UCF past Houston, 56-54
article.headline: Taylor's late layup lifts UCF past Houston, 56-54
article.linkText: Taylor's late layup lifts UCF past Houston, 56-54
article.story: ORLANDO, Fla. -- BJ Taylor's layup with 2.8 seconds left lifted Central Florida to a 56-54 victory over Houston Sunday. The win was the Knights second last-second win over Houston this season. Brandon Goodwin sent that game into overtime by hitting a 30-foot 3-pointer with two seconds left in regulation, then knocked down a second long 3 with 1.1 seconds left in overtime for a 79-78 win. This time it was Taylor with the heroics, driving down the right side of the key before banking in a contested layup for the lead. Houston got the ball across midcourt before the buzzer, but a long 3-point attempt sailed wide. Staphon Blair and Goodwin each scored 14 points to lead UCF (11-13, 4-9 American), with Kasey Wilson adding 13 points. Devonta Pollard scored 14 points to lead Houston (9-15, 1-11), with LeRon Barnes adding 12 points and Danrad Knowles eight rebounds.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.
